summary: This is the U.S. Government's memorandum in support of pretrial detention for Ghislaine Maxwell, filed in the Southern District of New York. It argues she is an extreme flight risk due to the seriousness of the charges, strength of evidence, her substantial financial resources, multiple citizenships, international connections, and lack of meaningful ties to the United States.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts and perjury, alleged to have partnered with Jeffrey Epstein to groom and abuse underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's partner in a scheme to sexually abuse underage girls at his properties; millions of dollars were transferred between his accounts and Maxwell's between 2007 and 2011.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the Government's memorandum as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, advocating for Maxwell's detention.

connections.description: Partners in a scheme to sexually exploit and abuse minor girls; Maxwell was one of Epstein's closest associates and played a key role in identifying, grooming, and facilitating abuse.
Substantial financial transfers occurred between accounts associated with Epstein and Maxwell, including millions of dollars transferred from Epstein to Maxwell between 2007 and 2011.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Scheme
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse underage girls at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell gave deposition testimony in a civil lawsuit in the Southern District of New York, where she allegedly lied under oath about her role in facilitating the abuse of minors.

events.title: Sale of NYC Residence
events.description: Maxwell sold a New York City residence for $15 million through an LLC, with over $14 million subsequently deposited into and transferred between her accounts.

events.title: Epstein Indictment Unsealed / Maxwell Goes into Hiding
events.description: After the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was unsealed, Maxwell ceased public appearances and began hiding in locations in New England, taking steps to avoid detection.

events.title: Purchase of New Hampshire Property
events.description: A 156-acre property in Bradford, New Hampshire, was acquired in an all-cash purchase through an anonymized LLC, where Maxwell was reportedly hiding.

events.title: Grand Jury Returns Sealed Indictment
events.description: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned a sealed indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with multiple counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors and perjury.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts (1994-1997) and two counts of perjury for false 2016 deposition testimony.

The government argues Maxwell is an extreme flight risk due to her three passports (US, UK, France), significant wealth (accounts holding up to $20M, $15M property sale), extensive international travel, and lack of meaningful US ties.
Maxwell allegedly played a key role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse scheme by befriending, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of girls as young as 14.
Financial records show millions of dollars transferred between Epstein-associated and Maxwell-associated accounts between 2007 and 2011.

After Epstein's July 2019 indictment was unsealed, Maxwell went into hiding, moving locations, changing contact information, and ultimately residing at a secluded New Hampshire property purchased anonymously in December 2019.
